label: Description
value: Woven velvet with two side-by-side symmetrical leaf and palmette forms (reversed at center line). Red silk pile in a red foundation with metallic gold supplementary weft patterning.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk, metallic thread Technique: supplementary warp pile (velvet); continuous supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Armchair with shaped openwork back, curved in plan; serpentine arms join back to scrolled front of seat; cabriole front legs, curved and splayed rear legs, all fitted with castors. Seat upholstered in green and cream colored fabric.

label: Physical description
value: Mahogany, laminated ash, oak and other woods

label: Description
value: Armchair with shaped openwork back, curved in plan; serpentine arms join back to scrolled front of seat; cabriole front legs, curved and splayed rear legs, all fitted with castors. Seat upholstered in green and cream colored fabric.

label: Physical description
value: Mahogany, laminated ash, oak and other woods

label: Description
value: Two aesthetic-style sidewall designs, printed in light and dark olive greens with gold accents.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Diamond-diaper or trellis design. Stylized four-petal floral motif in each grid, with quatrefoil in each trellis intersection. Printed in white mica on white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Floral sprigs and foliette sprigs, randomly joined in non-directional manner. Printed in yellow-green with gold floral highlights and gold dots, on light yellow-green ground. Printed in selvedge: "A.W.P.M.A."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Stripe design with 2 light-colored broad bands and 2 darker narrow bands.  The wide bands contain 2 alternating motifs: a group of flowers, with foliage and wheat, and a vase with a bouquet of flowers.  Printed in white and light gray  with metallic gold sprigs.  The narrow bands contain intertwined vines forming a guilloche pattern with a bird in the center. Printed with white and gold highlights.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Multicolor bouquets of carnations printed over gray striped ground.  Bouquets alternate with smaller lavender carnations.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Vining floral design.  Clusters of foliage, printed in 8 colors: shades of taupe with light gray shadow effect, with blue flowers. Vining tendrils printed in metallic gold. Printed on a white satin ground.  This piece was cut from the roll end with a section of unprinted white satin ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Anglo-Japanesque design. Very stylized floral motifs, in blue and burgundy, with green leaves and acanthus scrolls. Composed of very geometric ornaments in very random arrangement.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmark Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Butterflies amid poppies and grasses. Scalloped band of circular motifs across bottom.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Aesthetic or Anglo-Japanesque-style design, with stylized flowers and foliage in an asymmetrical key or fret framework.

label: Provenance
value: A remnant of a pattern hung in the hall and sitting room of the Butler-McCook house in Hartford, Connecticut (built 1782).

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Notes
value: Aesthetic or Anglo-Japanesque-style design, with stylized flowers and foliage in an asymmetrical key or fret framework.

label: Description
value: Aesthetic-style design, with chrysanthemums and other flowers, printed against a textured gold ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Large-scale flowers with band of circular motifs in grid across bottom edge. Printed on textured metallic gold ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Aesthetic style, floral pattern printed in shades of ochre with floral highlights of pink and blue. On embossed gold ground simulating a weave. Printed in selvedge: "A.W.P.M.A." and "1409".

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Antiquarian and Landmarks Society, Inc.

label: Description
value: Chinese painted scenic papers. A series of twenty four hand-painted panels, measuring 54 running feet, approximately 8'2" high. Depicting rockery, flowering trees, flowers, birds, etc. in a non-repeating, continuous fashion. Multi-colored.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Harry Paine Bingham

label: Notes
value: Chinese painted scenic papers. A series of twenty four hand-painted panels, measuring 54 running feet, approximately 8'2" high. Depicting rockery, flowering trees, flowers, birds, etc. in a non-repeating, continuous fashion. Multi-colored.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D (overall watch): 6 x 4 x 0.8 cm (2 3/8 x 1 9/16 x 5/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Dr. Charels W. Lester in memory of his wife, Marianne Stebbins Lester

label: Description
value: Two fragments of printed cotton imitating patchwork: rows of squares of two types each traditionally called "log cabin" in a stepped arrangement of bars enclosing a central square. Each shape has a small scale dotted or floral pattern (several Indian Paisley type) in dark browns and rust-reds.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

label: Description
value: Allover embroidered panel showing a basket filled with naturalistic flowers hanging from a branch of a tree stump growing from a small mound. Three butterflies hover at the top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in counted stitches

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1971: Mrs. Ivan Chermayeff collection; 1971: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Four lengths of linen stitched together to make a panel. Embroidered in red silk and gold metallic threads on an unbleached linen ground. Pattern of diagonal floral crosses alternating with rosettes; the crosses alternate direction with each row. With a geometric floral border at the top and bottom. Silk embroidery in counted stitches: double running, stem, and long-armed cross. Stitches using metallic yarn: chain and overcast loop.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk-core thread embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered in counted stitches on plain weave foundation

label: Description
value: Closely-set pattern of a thorn bush with leaves and berries. Pattern outlined in black, thorn branches in violet, leaves and berries in yellow, red, and blue. Natural cotton ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: relief printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Small scale allover pattern of a single diagonal floral sprig placed in half-drop vertical rows, facing left in one row and right in the other.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave with supplementary warp

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 109 x 55 cm (42 15/16 x 21 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Four natural linen rectangular fragments sewn together, each embroidered in brown wool showing a bird in a scrolling branch with exotic blossoms. Two panels the mirror image of the other. Length of weft-loop fringe of about 3" sewn to three sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool on linen Technique: embroidered

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (including fringe): 36 x 20.5 cm (14 3/16 x 8 1/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Two fragments of a continuous pattern in the bizarre style placed side by side. Ground in shades of gold with floral design in red, green, yellow and blue. Each fragment has one selvage present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft floats (brocade)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1971: Clara Waldeck collection; 1971: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Fragments of an all-over pattern made up of a bunch of roses with trailing floral vine and a fine detached flowering vine arranged in a group.  The groups are placed side by side and reversed end to end to counter balance movements.  Polychrome pattern on an "ivory on ivory" geometric-patterned background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: continuous [ivory] and discontinuous [polychrome] suplementary wefts plus supplementary warps [ivory] in a plain weave foundation [ivory].

label: Provenance
value: From the ex collection of Charles F. Ikle.

label: Description
value: Fragments of an all-over pattern made up of a bunch of roses with trailing floral vine and a fine detached flowering vine arranged in a group.  The groups are placed side by side and reversed end to end to counter balance movements.  Polychrome pattern on an "ivory on ivory" geometric-patterned background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: continuous (ivory) and discontinuous (polychrome) suplementary wefts plus supplementary warps (ivory) in a plain weave foundation (ivory)

label: Provenance
value: From the ex collection of Charles F. Ikle.

label: Description
value: Fragment of a large scale symmetrical pattern reversed on the center line of the textile. An urn with flowers placed in offset rows connected by a curving vine (almost an ogee framework) having grape vines and heads of wheat. Background is a dull salmon and the pattern is yellow twill. Intact selvage on right side.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: damassé (10-harness satin plus 9/1 twill with paired warps)

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 60.5 x 27 cm (23 13/16 x 10 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Three pieces stitched together, each patterned by upright symmetrical stylized plants in rust red silk with two narrow geometric borders at botton in blue on yellow; plain undyed linen at top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Fragment with a continuous symmetrical pattern reversed on the center line of the fabric. Ornate leaf forms, one on top of the other, surrounded by a leafy scroll frame. Pattern in gold and silver outlined by ivory silk on a gold background.

label: Description
value: Length of woven silk in green and ivory with symmetrical pattern reversed along vertical axis. Design shows elaborate plant forms and pomegranate motifs crowned with foliate scrolls. Both selvages present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: warp-faced plain weave with 3/1 twill

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1971: Clara Waldeck collection; 1971: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: A resting figure fanning itself sitting upon a tall column. The figure has pulled back dark hair and is wearing a robe.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D: 162.6 x 45.7 x 45.7 cm (5 ft. 4 in. x 18 in. x 18 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Albert C. Bostwick

label: Description
value: Red earthenware bowl with visible throwing rings. Thick round foot. Traces of slip on exterior. Interior rim painted with a rust-colored line. Interior of bowl painted with profile of a bird in rust, with wings, eyes and long, curling feather in yellow over red. Repairs.

label: Physical description
value: Wheel thrown earthenware, slip, underglaze painted in polychrome pigments under a transparent glaze

label: Description
value: Oblong, rounded upper frame and circular seat frame superimposed to a circular stretcher.  Long, curved armrails depart from seat back and loop around in air to connect to the seat frame.  Another bent wood half-loop emulates the shape and direction of the top of the seat back.  Legs taper, with back legs pointing outwards more drastically as they meet the floor.

label: Creator name
value: South Carolina Vienna Bent Wood Furniture Company

label: Description
value:
Simple cabriole legs ending in club feet; tall back rounded at top; seat and back upholstered in tapestry of red ground decorated with scrollwork and vase of flowers in cartouche in tones of cream, tan, ochre and green.  Chairs -1a, -1b and -1d with fitted covers of green fabric.
1a- Needle point of large bouquet of flowers on seat
1b- Needle point of bird on seat
1c- Needle point of small bouquet of flowers on seat
1d- Needle point of small bouquet of flowers on seat

label: Provenance
value: George D. Widener; 1972: bequested to Museum

label: Physical description
value: Machine-printed sidewall with block printed border

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Robert B. De Blieux´

value: Gift of Robert B. De Blieux´

label: Description
value: Square pillow cover with a scene of a castle garden, with a man bathing his feet in a fountain, three ladies washing their hands in another, and a man playing the lyre from an overlooking balcony. With a wide floral border on all four sides.

label: Description
value: Sample of paper from Duluth City Directory, with ad of J.F. Gordon.
